page.title: 18Brackley disabled day centre
page.content: Evenley Hall is a large house on a hill between Brackley and Evenley. The National Children's Trust own it now but it was built in 1740 by a Cornish man called Francis Bassett. In the bad winter of 1897 there was a fire at Evenley Hall. Fire engines in those days were pulled by horses and when at last the firemen reached it and tried to pump the water, it froze in the hose! The Hall was not badly damaged but needed a new roof. Until recently Evenley Hall was a children's home . Children lived there if their parents had broken up or were ill. At one time there were fifty- seven children in five groups,each group having a House Mother and Father. In 1980 it was made into a home for disabled young people. They come during the day to do craftwork and gardening and to enjoy each other's company.
